title: From Shakespeare to Turner: a history of the £20 note and its famous faces
text:
The design of the new £20 banknote, featuring painter JMW Turner, has been revealed by the Bank of England.

The new polymer banknote will launch on Feb 20 2020, the bank has announced, and will join the existing Winston Churchill £5 note and the Jane Austen £10 note, which were launched in September 2016 and 2017 respectively.

The new £20 note will feature a blue and gold design which depicts the Margate lighthouse and Turner Contemporary gallery, also located in Margate, where the artist grew up.

The Bank of England, which issues the banknotes, said the new plastic ones are harder to counterfeit and more durable, meaning they need to be replaced less frequently.
